sen.e: Grand master
Grand master
Grand master
Someone who has good qualities or behavior that other people should copy.
Someone who has good qualities or behavior that other people should copy.
Someone who has good qualities or behavior that other people should copy.

sen.j: 武道や芸道分野の指導者。
sen.e: An instructor of budo (martial arts) or geido (accomplishments of art.)
An instructor of budo (martial arts) or geido (accomplishments of art.)
An instructor of budo (martial arts) or geido (accomplishments of art.)

sen.j: または、その流派や道場から門下生を指導教授する者に対して与えられる職位または免許、称号の事。
sen.e: Or a license and a title given from a school of the accomplishment or dojo (training hall) of the martial arts to a person who trains the disciples.
Or a license and a title given from a school of the accomplishment or dojo (training hall) of the martial arts to a person who leads and trains the disciples.
sen.cmt: leadsを追加してleads and trains としました。
sen.e: Or a license and a title given from a school of the accomplishment or dojo (training hall) of the martial arts to a person who leads and trains the disciples.
It is also called shihan i (rank of grand master), shihan go (title of grand master.)
It is also called shihan i (rank of grand master), shihan go (title of grand master.)
It is also called shihan i (rank of grand master), shihan go (title of grand master.)

sen.j: 下位には準師範ないし師範代が置かれる（流派等により差異あり）。
sen.e: Under the grand master, junshihan (an associate grand master) or shihandai (an assistant instructor) is positioned (depending on schools.)
Under the grand master, junshihan (an associate grand master) or shihandai (an assistant instructor) is positioned (depending on schools and the like).
sen.cmt: and the likeを追加しました。
sen.e: Under the grand master, junshihan (an associate grand master) or shihandai (an assistant instructor) is positioned (depending on schools and the like).

sen.j: 都道府県警察本部において任ずる剣道、逮捕術等術科の指導者の職位。
sen.e: A job title of an instructor of a course including kendo (Japanese art of fencing), taihojutsu (arresting art), or the like, who is appointed by each police headquarter of administrative divisions of Japan: Tokyo-to, Hokkai-do, Osaka-fu, Kyoto-fu and remaining prefectures.

Job titles for instructors, appointed by each police headquarters of administrative divisions of Japan: Tokyo-to, Hokkai-do, Osaka-fu, Kyoto-fu and other prefectures, of training courses such as kendo (Japanese art of fencing), taihojutsu (arresting art) and the like.
sen.cmt: 表現の見直ししました。
sen.e: Job titles for instructors, appointed by each police headquarters of administrative divisions of Japan: Tokyo-to, Hokkai-do, Osaka-fu, Kyoto-fu and other prefectures, of training courses such as kendo (Japanese art of fencing), taihojutsu (arresting art) and the like.

sen.j: 学問・武芸・技芸等の先生。
sen.e: A teacher of learning, military arts, or practical arts.
A teacher of learning, military arts, or practical arts.
A teacher of learning, military arts, or practical arts.

sen.j: また、資格の名としても用いる。
sen.e: It is also used as a naming of a license.
It is also used as a naming of a license.
It is also used as a naming of a license.
An abbreviated name of a school for teacher training.
An abbreviated name of a school for teacher training.
An abbreviated name of a school for teacher training.

sen.j: 武道・芸道における師範
sen.e: A grand master in martial arts and accomplishments.
Grand masters in martial arts and accomplishments.
Grand masters in martial arts and accomplishments.

sen.j: 師範は剣術、居合道、剣道、合気道、空手などの武道、その他、芸道における指導者の職位或いは免許、称号を意味し、師範号とも称される。
sen.e: Shihan (grand master) is a job title, a license, or a title of an instructor of martial arts including swordplay, iaido (art of drawing the Japanese sword), kendo (Japanese art of fencing), aikido (art of weaponless self-defense), and karate (traditional Japanese martial art), and other accomplishments, and it is also called shihan go (title of grand master.)

Shihan (grand master) is a job title, a license, or a title of an instructor of martial arts including swordplay, iaido (art of drawing the Japanese sword), kendo (Japanese art of fencing), aikido (art of weaponless self-defense), and karate (traditional Japanese martial art), and other accomplishments, and it is also called shihan go (title of grand master.)

Shihan (grand master) is a job title, a license, or a title of an instructor of martial arts including swordplay, iaido (art of drawing the Japanese sword), kendo (Japanese art of fencing), aikido (art of weaponless self-defense), and karate (traditional Japanese martial art), and other accomplishments, and it is also called shihan go (title of grand master.)

sen.j: 師範は流派ないしその道場の道場主等から免許される。
sen.e: The license of the grand master is given from the head of the school of the accomplishments or the owner of the training hall of the martial arts.
The license of the grand master is given from the head of the school of the accomplishments or the owner of the training hall of the martial arts.
The license of the grand master is given from the head of the school of the accomplishments or the owner of the training hall of the martial arts.

sen.j: 師範の免許を有する事で指導者としての資格及び流派の傘下としての道場を開く事を許される場合が多い。
sen.e: In many cases, when you get the grand master license, you are qualified as the leader and permitted to establish your own training hall as a member affiliated with the school.
In many cases, when you get the grand master license, you are qualified as an instructor and permitted to establish your own training hall as a member affiliated with the school.
sen.cmt: as the leader --> as an instructor
sen.e: In many cases, when you get the grand master license, you are qualified as an instructor and permitted to establish your own training hall as a member affiliated with the school.

sen.j: 柔道の場合、師範とは「嘉納治五郎」一人のみを指し、他の武道における師範とは異なる。
sen.e: Judo is different from the other martial arts and the grand master of Judo is Jigoro KANO only.
Judo is different from the other martial arts in that the grand master of Judo is Jigoro KANO only.
Judo is different from the other martial arts in that the grand master of Judo is Jigoro KANO only.
